intro: Zanthoxylum riedelianum subsp. mayanum, commonly known as the Mayan prickly ash, is a shrub or small tree native to Central America and parts of the Caribbean. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces red, fleshy berries that are an important food source for various wildlife species. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, well-drained soils. The subspecies is notable for its ornamental value and use in traditional medicine.
